intro: Melandrium affine subsp. tenellum, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. It is a relatively short-lived species, often found in temperate climates with moderate moisture levels.
